intro: Dicrastylis velutina, commonly known as the velvetleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It is often found in moist, disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including wetlands and grasslands. Dicrastylis velutina is adapted to coastal and inland regions, showing some tolerance to saline conditions.
